question:
Why is breadth-first search (BFS) guaranteed to find the shortest path in an unweighted graph?
A) It explores nodes randomly
B) It uses recursion
C) It explores nodes in increasing path length order
D) It minimizes memory usage
correct_option_text: It explores nodes in increasing path length order

question:
What is the main drawback of using a very large context window in a transformer model?
A) Reduced expressiveness
B) Increased risk of vanishing gradients
C) Quadratic computational and memory cost
D) Loss of positional information entirely

Which scenario most clearly indicates data leakage in a machine learning pipeline?
A) High training accuracy
B) Low validation accuracy
C) Validation data influencing feature normalization
D) Using cross-validation

Why is iterative deepening depth-first search (IDDFS) often preferred over DFS for unknown-depth problems?
A) It uses less memory than BFS while remaining complete
B) It avoids recursion
C) It always expands fewer nodes
D) It guarantees optimal paths in weighted graphs
correct_option_text: It uses less memory than BFS while remaining complete
